CatDescriptText: Ramon Thompson, student, 218 Lombard Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 23, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that there will be a steel strike?  Do you think steelworkers are entitled to the raise which they requested or do you think wages should be frozen, according to the argument of the steel industry management?" answer reads: "I really don't know whether or not there will be a steel strike, because I have not been keeping up with current events.  However, I do think that a raise in pay is justified for steelworkers."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ramon Thompson wearing plaid short sleeve shirt, standing in front of a store window with displays that read "More homes painted with SWP house paint than any other brand," "It's time to brighten up!," "Just say 'Charge it' we'll open your account today," and "Most people... Super Kem...," possibly on Liberty Avenue
